FuncDef: The display cpu-defend hostcar config slot command displays the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side packets sent to the CPU on a specified board, or the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side packets with the same VLAN ID sent to the CPU on a specified board.
CLIs: display cpu-defend { hostcar | vlan-host-car | http-hostcar } config slot <slotid>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side packets sent to the CPU.
-

Displays the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side packets with the same VLAN ID sent to the CPU.
-

Displays the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side web packets sent to the CPU.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display cpu-defend hostcar command is used to display the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side packets sent to the CPU on a specified board, or the default and actual CAR parameter values of the user-side packets with the same VLAN ID sent to the CPU on a specified board.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
